name: Manaflow
long_description:
Manaflow is an applied AI lab building new interfaces for the future of software engineering. We're the creators of cmux, a universal AI coding agent manager that supports Claude Code, Codex, Gemini CLI, Amp, Opencode, and other coding CLIs. 

cmux helps software engineers context switch between tasks, deploy coding agents safely in cloud sandboxes, and verify AI-written code through preview environments.

You can use cmux like Jira, Asana, or GitHub Issues, writing a bunch of tickets like a todos list â€“ except cmux will deploy AI coding agents of your choice to complete the tickets for you. 

For every task that you start, cmux will:
- Start up dev environments that include VS Code + browser previews for any dev servers so you can visually verify and test live changes fast
- Spin up cloud sandboxes to safely deploy AI coding agents in YOLO mode so they can move fast and NOT break things
- Evaluate all of the code diffs for all of your selected AI coding agents when they finish their tasks and choose the best version for you

The future of software engineering will be managing, verifying, and reviewing 10+ coding tasks done by AI agents simultaneously. Manaflow is building these interfaces to enable engineers to become 10x more productive with AI.

cmux is an open-source app, and you can also bring your own API keys or OpenAI and Claude Max subscriptions. You can download cmux for free at https://www.cmux.dev/.
one_liner: Interface for managing AI coding agents in parallel to do tasks
